title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, crisp pancetta/bacon in a pan over medium heat. Remove bacon, leave rendered fat.
In a bowl, whisk eggs, Pecorino, Parmesan, and a generous amount of black pepper.
Drain pasta, reserving about 1 cup of pasta water.
Add hot pasta to the pan with bacon fat. Quickly pour in egg mixture, tossing continuously to coat the pasta.
Add a splash of pasta water to create a creamy sauce. Continue tossing until creamy and heated through.
Stir in the crisp pancetta. Serve immediately with extra cheese and pepper.
author: Chef Maria

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: 500g boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into cubes
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, cumin, garam masala, chili powder, and lemon juice for at least 30 minutes (or overnight).
Grill or pan-fry chicken until cooked through and slightly charred. Set aside.
In a large pot, melt butter. Sauté onion until golden brown.
Add remaining ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute. Add crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Stir in grilled chicken and heavy cream. Simmer for another 5-10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan bread.
author: Chef Sanjay

title: Fresh Garden Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette
summary: A vibrant and healthy salad packed with fresh vegetables and a zesty homemade dressing.
instructions: Wash and dry all vegetables thoroughly.
In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and bell pepper.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, and minced garlic.
Season dressing with salt and pepper.
Drizzle dressing over salad just before serving.
Toss gently to combine and serve immediately.
author: Chef Alex

title: Grilled Salmon with Asparagus
summary: Healthy and flavorful grilled salmon fillets with tender, crisp asparagus.
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Brush salmon fillets with 1 tbsp olive oil, season with salt, pepper, and dill.
Toss asparagus with remaining 1 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Grill salmon for 4-6 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Grill asparagus for 5-7 minutes, turning occasionally, until tender-crisp.
Squeeze fresh lemon juice over salmon and asparagus before serving.
author: Chef David

title: Vegetable Stir-fry
summary: A quick and delicious stir-fry with a variety of colorful vegetables and a savory sauce.
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat.
Add broccoli and carrots, stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add bell pepper and snap peas, stir-fry for another 3-4 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, and rice vinegar.
Pour sauce over vegetables. Bring to a simmer.
Stir in cornstarch slurry and cook until sauce thickens.
Serve immediately over cooked rice.
author: Chef Emily

title: Beef Tacos
summary: Flavorful ground beef seasoned with taco spices, served in warm tortillas with fresh toppings.
instructions: Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Drain excess fat.
Stir in taco seasoning and water. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5-7 minutes, until sauce thickens.
Warm tortillas according to package directions (microwave or skillet).
Set out beef and desired toppings.
Let everyone build their own tacos.
author: Chef Roberto

title: Lentil Soup
summary: A hearty and nutritious vegetarian soup, perfect for a cozy meal.
ingredients: 1 cup brown or green lentils, rinsed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Sauté onion, carrots, and celery until softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in rinsed lentils, vegetable broth, diced tomatoes, thyme, and bay leaf.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30-35 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
Remove bay leaf. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
author: Chef Anna

title: Classic Margherita Pizza
summary: A simple yet iconic Italian pizza with fresh mozzarella, basil, and tomato sauce.
ingredients: 8 oz fresh mozzarella, sliced or torn
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C) with a pizza stone or baking sheet inside.
Stretch pizza dough into a desired shape on a lightly floured surface.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a small border for the crust.
Arrange mozzarella slices/tears over the sauce.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Carefully transfer pizza to the hot oven. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until crust is golden and cheese is bubbly and lightly browned.
Remove from oven, scatter fresh basil leaves over the top, slice, and serve.
author: Chef Paolo

title: Blueberry Pancakes
summary: Fluffy pancakes studded with fresh blueberries, a perfect breakfast treat.
ingredients: 2 tbsp melted butter, plus more for cooking
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir until just combined (don't overmix, lumps are okay).
Gently fold in blueberries.
Heat a lightly buttered griddle or non-stick pan over medium heat.
Pour about 1/4 cup of batter per pancake onto the griddle.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Serve immediately with maple syrup.
author: Baker Jane

title: Beef and Broccoli Stir-fry
summary: Tender strips of beef and crisp broccoli florets in a savory ginger-garlic sauce.
ingredients: 500g flank steak, thinly sliced against the grain
instructions: Marinate beef slices with 1 tbsp soy sauce and 1 tbsp cornstarch for 15 minutes.
Heat 1 tbsp sesame oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat. Stir-fry beef in batches until browned. Remove from pan.
Add remaining 1 tbsp sesame oil, broccoli, and bell pepper to the pan. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until tender-crisp.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger, stir-fry for 1 minute until fragrant.
In a small bowl, whisk together beef broth, oyster sauce, and brown sugar.
Return beef to the pan with vegetables. Pour in the sauce and simmer for 2-3 minutes until sauce thickens.
Serve immediately over cooked rice.
author: Chef Lee

title: Creamy Tomato Soup with Grilled Cheese
summary: Classic comforting creamy tomato soup served with a crispy, gooey grilled cheese sandwich.
instructions: For the soup: Heat olive oil in a pot. Sauté onion until softened. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, broth, and basil. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat and cook for 20 minutes.
Stir in heavy cream, season with salt and pepper. Blend until smooth with an immersion blender (or transfer to a regular blender).
For the grilled cheese: Butter one side of each bread slice.
Place cheese between unbuttered sides of two bread slices. Repeat for all sandwiches.
Heat a skillet over medium heat. Grill sandwiches for 3-5 minutes per side, until golden brown and cheese is melted.
Serve soup with grilled cheese sandwiches.
author: Chef Chloe

title: Homemade Hummus with Pita
summary: Creamy, smooth homemade hummus served with warm pita bread and fresh vegetables.
ingredients: 1 (15 oz) can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
2 tbsp olive oil, plus more for drizzling
Pita bread and vegetable sticks for serving
instructions: In a food processor, combine chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, 2 tbsp olive oil, cumin, and salt.
Process until smooth, gradually adding cold water 1 tablespoon at a time until desired consistency is reached.
Taste and adjust seasonings if necessary.
Transfer hummus to a serving bowl. Drizzle with a little extra olive oil.
Serve with warm pita bread, cucumber sticks, carrot sticks, and bell pepper strips.
author: Chef Samir

title: Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken
summary: Whole roasted chicken infused with lemon and aromatic herbs, perfectly juicy and tender.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Pat chicken dry with paper towels.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, paprika, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Rub the spice mixture all over the chicken. Place lemon slices, rosemary, thyme, and smashed garlic inside the chicken cavity.
Tie chicken legs together with kitchen twine.
Place chicken in a roasting pan. Roast for 1 hour 15 minutes to 1 hour 30 minutes, or until internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C) in the thickest part of the thigh.
Rest chicken for 10-15 minutes before carving and serving.
author: Chef Oliver

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
summary: Classic warm and chewy chocolate chip cookies with a hint of sea salt.
ingredients: 2 cups chocolate chips (milk, semi-sweet, or dark)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, cream together softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add dry ingredients to wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto prepared baking sheets.
Bake for 9-11 minutes, or until edges are golden brown and centers are still soft.
Sprinkle with flaky sea salt (if using) immediately after removing from oven.
Cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
author: Baker Laura

title: Shrimp Scampi with Linguine
summary: Succulent shrimp tossed in a garlicky butter-wine sauce with fresh parsley over linguine.
ingredients: 1/2 cup dry white wine or chicken broth
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook linguine according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil and butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add shrimp and cook for 1-2 minutes per side, until pink and opaque. Remove shrimp from pan and set aside.
Add minced garlic to the skillet and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant (do not burn).
Pour in white wine (or broth) and lemon juice. Bring to a simmer and cook for 2-3 minutes to reduce slightly.
Return shrimp to the skillet. Add cooked linguine and chopped parsley. Toss to combine.
Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes if desired. Serve immediately.
author: Chef Marco

title: Vegetable Lasagna
summary: Layers of pasta, rich tomato sauce, creamy ricotta, and a medley of fresh vegetables.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Sauté onion, bell pepper, zucchini, and mushrooms until softened, about 8-10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
In a medium bowl, combine ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, egg, and parsley. Season with salt and pepper.
Spread a thin layer of marinara sauce in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Layer 4 lasagna noodles, then half of the ricotta mixture, half of the sautéed vegetables, and a third of the mozzarella. Top with more marinara sauce.
Repeat layers. Finish with a final layer of noodles, remaining marinara sauce, and the rest of the mozzarella cheese.
Cover with foil and bake for 45 minutes. Remove foil and bake for another 15-20 minutes, or until bubbly and cheese is golden brown.
Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
author: Chef Isabella

title: Simple Guacamole
summary: Fresh and zesty homemade guacamole, perfect for dipping.
ingredients: 1-2 jalapeño, finely minced (remove seeds for less heat)
instructions: Halve avocados, remove pits, and scoop flesh into a medium bowl.
Mash avocados with a fork to desired consistency (chunky or smooth).
Stir in red onion, cilantro, jalapeño, lime juice, and salt.
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.
Serve immediately with tortilla chips.
author: Chef Diego

title: Chicken Noodle Soup
summary: Classic comforting chicken noodle soup, perfect for a cold day or when you're feeling under the weather.
ingredients: 2 cups cooked chicken, shredded or diced
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Sauté onion, carrots, and celery until softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in chicken broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add cooked chicken, egg noodles, and thyme. Cook for another 8-10 minutes, or until noodles are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Ladle into bowls and garnish with fresh parsley.
author: Chef Grandma

title: Pasta Primavera
summary: A light and fresh pasta dish loaded with seasonal vegetables.
ingredients: Fresh basil or parsley for garnish
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water, then drain.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add broccoli and asparagus, sauté for 5-7 minutes until tender-crisp.
Add cherry tomatoes and minced garlic, cook for another 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
Stir in frozen peas, vegetable broth, and lemon juice. Bring to a simmer.
Add cooked pasta to the skillet with vegetables. Toss to combine, adding reserved pasta water if needed to create a light sauce.
Stir in Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with fresh basil or parsley and serve immediately.
author: Chef Sofia

title: Baked Ziti
summary: Classic Italian-American comfort food with ziti pasta baked in a rich tomato sauce with layers of cheese.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cook ziti pasta according to package directions until al dente. Drain.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Sauté onion until softened. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato sauce, oregano, and red pepper flakes (if using). Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat and cook for 15 minutes.
In a medium bowl, combine ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, egg, and parsley. Season with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, combine cooked ziti with about 1/2 of the tomato sauce.
Spread a thin layer of sauce on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Layer half of the ziti mixture, then half of the ricotta mixture, and 1 cup of mozzarella cheese.
Repeat layers with remaining ziti, ricotta, and 1 cup of mozzarella. Top with remaining sauce.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until bubbly and cheese is melted and lightly browned.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
author: Chef Giovanni

title: Avocado Toast with Poached Egg
summary: Creamy avocado mashed on toast, topped with a perfectly poached egg and chili flakes.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Fresh cilantro or chives for garnish
instructions: Toast bread to desired crispness.
Halve avocado, remove pit, and scoop flesh into a small bowl. Mash with a fork. Stir in lime juice, salt, and pepper.
To poach eggs: Bring a pot of water to a gentle simmer. Add white vinegar.
Crack each egg into a small ramekin or bowl. Gently slide one egg at a time into the simmering water.
Cook for 3-4 minutes for a runny yolk. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Spread mashed avocado evenly over toasted bread.
Top each slice with a poached egg. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes and garnish with fresh cilantro or chives.
Serve immediately.
author: Chef Olivia

title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Chili
summary: A hearty and flavorful vegetarian chili with sweet potatoes, black beans, and warm spices.
ingredients: 1 large sweet potato, peeled and diced
2 (15 oz) cans black beans, rinsed and drained
Salt and black pepper to taste
Optional toppings: shredded cheese, sour cream, avocado, fresh cilantro
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Sauté onion until softened.
Add garlic, sweet potato, and bell pepper. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in black beans, crushed tomatoes, vegetable broth, chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, and cayenne pepper (if using).
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30-35 minutes, or until sweet potatoes are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with desired toppings.
author: Chef Ben

title: Pan-Seared Pork Chops with Apple Compote
summary: Tender pan-seared pork chops complemented by a sweet and tangy apple compote.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
2 medium apples (e.g., Gala, Honeycrisp), cored and sliced
instructions: Pat pork chops dry. Season generously with sage, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
For the apple compote: In a small saucepan, melt 1 tbsp butter over medium heat. Add sliced apples, apple cider, brown sugar, and cinnamon.
Cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until apples are tender and sauce has thickened. Set aside.
For the pork chops: Heat remaining 1 tbsp olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear pork chops for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown.
Transfer skillet to a preheated 375°F (190°C) oven.
Bake for 8-12 minutes, or until internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
Rest pork chops for 5 minutes before serving with apple compote.
author: Chef Paul

title: Caprese Skewers with Balsamic Glaze
summary: Elegant and refreshing skewers of cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze.
ingredients: 24 small fresh mozzarella balls (bocconcini or ciliegine), drained
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Thread one cherry tomato, one mozzarella ball, and one basil leaf onto each small skewer.
Arrange skewers on a platter.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and black pepper.
Drizzle generously with balsamic glaze just before serving.
author: Chef Enzo
